restaurants.Want to add your fantastic deal for peop: Cruise over to 'My Deals', and smack that 'Add Deal' button like it owes you money!
restaurants.Trying to get the 'Verified' cool kid ba:
Swing by 'My Account' and politely tap the 'Request Verify' button. It’ll ring our digital doorbell! 

In order for users to view your deals, we'll need to verify you.
restaurants.Want to reset your password?: Been there, done that! Saunter on over to 'My Profile' and click 'Password Reset'.
restaurants.Need to spruce up your deal's details?: Click your deal in 'My Deals', and tap 'Edit'. Or, channel your inner Picasso!
restaurants.Deal gone sour?: Want to ditch it? Head into 'My Deals' and swipe that deal into oblivion, or tap it and delete your masterpiece forever. No hard feelings!
restaurants.How do I delete my account?: If you wish to delete your account, please click

users.Are we only in Ottawa?: For now, yes! But we've got our suitcases packed! More cities coming soon!
users.Wanna see deals near you based on your l: Proximity is here! Tap the filter on the far right of the search bar. Deals are by default, sorted by closest to you!
users.Spotted a drool-worthy deal and dont wan: Show some love! Tap the heart in the top right of the deal's image to save it for later.
users.Can't remember where your heart went?: Jog on over to 'My Deals' and witness your collection of heart-throbing deals!
users.Got specific deal cravings or just want: Click on our smorgasbord of deal types and tags. It's like a buffet, but for deals!
users.How do I delete my account?: If you wish to delete your account, please click
users.Why are some deals shown and some greyed: Every deal thats shown is live today! That means you can enjoy its benefits right now. Some deals are marked 'Live soon' which will be live sometime in the next 2 days

quotes: “Drink heavily with locals whenever possible”
“An egg in anything makes it better”
“An ounce of sauce covers a multitude of sins”
“People who love to eat are always the best people”
“To eat is a necessity, but to eat intelligently is an art”
“Laughter is brightest where food is best”
“Life is a combination of magic and pasta”
“Lettuce save you some money!”
“A whole lot of dough to save!”
“Intoxicatingly affordable drink deals!”
“Straight-up, syrupy sweet deals!”
“Wrap up your worries, and unwrap these deals!”
“Here crumbs the deals!”
“Ready to feast without the financial famine?”
“Brace your belly, savings are coming!”
“Life is too short to skip Happy Hour”
“Take a pitcher, it'll last longer”
“Stop and smell the rosé”
“Drink happy thoughts”
“I drink to make other people interesting”
“As God is my witness, I'll never be hungry again.”
“A martini. Shaken, not stirred.”
“It’s so damn hot! Milk was a bad choice.”
“Fish are friends, not food.”
“Jenny and me was like peas and carrots.”
“Is butter a carb?”
“Carbs are the answer. No matter the question.”
“My favorite flavor of cake is more.”
“Fries before guys…and pretty much everything else.”
“I just want someone to look at me the way I look at food.”
“There’s no “we” in ice cream.”
“Home is wherever I’m with food.”
“Love means never having to say 'Should we get dessert?””
“Abs are temporary. Chocolate is forever.”
“Fun size is for quitters.”
“The only clubs I’m interested in are sandwiches.”
“Diet tip: Don’t.”
“My bank account may be on a diet, but I am certainly not”
“I’m not broke, I’m just pre rich”
“Life’s too short to stay at home”
“Eating out: where calories don’t count”
“Food taste better when you didn’t have to cook it”
“Don’t threaten me with a good time”
“My favourite outdoor activity: finding the nearest patio”
“I'm on a seafood diet. I see food, and I eat it.”
“The secret ingredient is always cheese.”
“When life gives you lemons, find a tequila bar.”
“Friendship is sharing nachos, even if it's 'cheesy.”
“Barbecue and beer: The fuel of scholars.”
“Maple syrup shots: Our liquid courage in cold times.”
“Patio season: The time when ice melts into smiles.”
“Mama Always Said Life Was Like A Box Of Chocolates.”
“Anyway, like I was sayin', shrimp is the fruit of the sea.”
“You can barbecue it, boil it, broil it, bake it, saute it.”
